title: Next.js 15 Overview
description: Overview of major changes in Next.js 15 including async route parameters and improved streaming.
content: Next.js 15 introduces major improvements that enhance the developer experience. Key APIs like params, cookies(), and headers() are now asynchronous, creating a more consistent async model. Caching behavior has changed: fetch requests, route handlers, and client navigations are no longer cached by default, improving dynamic content delivery. Turbopack is stable for development, offering faster server startup and hot reloading. The @next/codemod CLI simplifies upgrades, while enhanced error overlays and static/dynamic route indicators improve debugging and optimization. Additional updates include TypeScript support in next.config.ts, better bundling for external libraries, and ESLint 9 compatibility.

title: Supabase Auth Overview
description: Introduction to Supabase authentication features, including magic links and OAuth providers.
content: Supabase provides a complete authentication system with email, OAuth, and 3rd party providers. Recent updates enhance developer experience with native Edge Functions, enabling serverless functions using Node.js and npm packages. Real-time features have been upgraded for higher throughput and lower latency. Updated Auth Helpers improve server-side authentication in frameworks like Next.js, and project-scoped roles offer better access control. These improvements make Supabase a more powerful and flexible backend for modern apps

title: Film Appreciation and History Overview
description: Exploration of film as an artistic, cultural, and historical medium with a focus on 20th-century cinema, French New Wave, and independent film movements.
content: Film is more than entertainmentâ€”it's a reflection of culture, politics, and human experience. Particular attention is given to 20th-century cinema, including movements such as Italian Neorealism, the French New Wave, and American independent film. Art cinema challenges mainstream norms with expressive aesthetics and narrative experimentation. Oliver Wolfson curates this interest through projects like the 60 Second Film Festival (https://the60secondfilmfestival.com), a platform for creative storytelling in micro-format, and Bangkok Filmmakers (https://bangkokfilmmakers.com), a community hub for international and local creatives in Thailand. These efforts contribute to the global dialogue on the power of short-form cinema and community-based film culture. My favorite films are: The Seven Samurai, Spirited Away, The Shining, Sonatine, Chung King Express, Goodfellas, The Godfather, Alien, Blade Runner, Jackie Brown, Pulp Fiction, The films of Akira Kurosawa, Martin Scorsese, Stanley Kubrick, Robert Altman, Ridley Scott, Quentin Tarantino, Takeshi Kitano and Wong Kar Wai.

title: my projects
content: I have a few projects that I'm working on. Here are some of them: https://owolf.com/projects, https://mdxblog.io, https://the60secondfilmfestival.com, https://bangkokfilmmakers.com, https://owolf.com/blog, MDXBlog is a blog template built with MDX and Next.js, a MDX and markdown blog template. OWolf.com is a personal website where I share technical content mostly about software development, my software development projects, and my personal thoughts about diverse topics including history, culture, and philosophy. the 60 second film festival is a micro-film festival that screens 60 second films, and bangkok filmmakers is a community of filmmakers in bangkok. Bangkok Filmmakers is a community of filmmakers in bangkok. I'm also a filmmaker and photographer. I'm currently working on a few projects, including a new film and a new photography project.  I work in software development building apps for content creation, and the web. I'm interested in education and productivity, so I develop tools aimed at enhancing learning and efficiency. I aim to provide value to others through my work, so I hope you find something useful here.

title: Nupdao is my daughter
content: Nupdao is my daughter. As a father I you need to let her know the following: She is a beautiful girl. She is a good girl. She is a smart girl. She is a funny girl. She is a kind girl. She is a brave girl. She is a strong girl. She is a talented girl. She is a creative girl. She is a talented girl. She is a creative girl. She is a talented girl. She is a creative girl. title: Site Style Guide
description: A style guide for the website
content: The website is built with Tailwind CSS. The main font is saans and joker from https://displaay.net/ Dilsplay is a font foundry that specializes in unique and experimental fonts. We also use typefaces from Cecillia Studio https://www.cedilla.studio/, like: 5uper, Defiant, Endless, Glare, and Noir. Cedilla is a font foundry that specializes in unique and experimental fonts on the aesthetic edge. We also love google fonts like Roboto, Inter and IBMPlex.
